text_en: SUI 3 Follow-up RECOMMENDATIONS ON FREQUENCY OF CONTACT 1 » MAINTAIN REGULAR CONTACT (via telephone, home visits, letters or contact ASSESS FOR IMPROVEMENT cards) more frequently initially (e.g. daily, weekly) for the first 2 months. » Follow-up for as long as the risk of Is the person improving? self-harm/suicide persists. » Decrease contact as the person improves. » Continue following-up for 2 years, further decreasing contact according to improvement (e.g. once every 2-4 weeks after the initial 2 months, and twice in the second year). » Increase intensity or duration of contact as necessary. » Refer to specialist as needed. 2 ROUTINELY ASSESS FOR THOUGHTS AND PLANS OF SELF-HARM/SUICIDE » At every contact, routinely assess for suicidal thoughts and plans. Is the risk of self-harm/suicide imminent? See SUI 1 (Assessment). SELF-HARM /SUICIDE 139 140 SELF HARM / SUICIDE
